Hi, I work with parasoft tech support and the answer to the question 
below=
 is yes.  One can use an @pre tag in javadoc to find such 
problems.

Carso=
n

--- In junit@y..., Ilja Preu=DF <ilja.preuss@w...> wrote:
> > The proble=
m is that I don't know if there was a problem with
> > the input, the proce=
ssing or something random. If your code
> > returns an IllegalArgumentExcep=
tion, then I have a much
> > better idea of the issues.
> 
> If you are on =
the same team, you could ask him. Possibly you could 
even
> find out by si=
mply looking at the code and/or the JUnit tests.
> 
> One point I find more=
 critical is that invalid input should be
> fail-fast. If a method fails be=
cause you provided invalid input to a
> prior method call, such problems ar=
e really hard to find. Can JTest 
help
> with such issues?
> 
> Regards, Il=
ja
